text: Helly Assim, feel free anytime to shoot over any questions you have

Hey Neal, thanks for agreeing to help me out. I guess I would start by telling you a bit about myself, I am a 3rd visual effects student at the University of South Wales. The course is mainly focused on compositing but it supports other aspects of vfx as well. If it wouldn't be any trouble I would like to receive some feedback on my current showreel, <https://youtu.be/R29P8iupUwI>.

attachments.title: VFX Showreel 2020: Assim Kamuka
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: VFX Showreel 2020: Assim Kamuka
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/R29P8iupUwI?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: sure, i'll take a look soon and give you some notes

i don't know how much youve been told about me, but feel free to add me on LinkedIn where you can see my experience and if you have any questions in general about Comp or anything VFX based, feel free to drop me a line

so had a quick look, first think i would say is to put your reel on Vimeo rather than YouTube. It is more professional to have it one there when applying for jobs and what most people use in the industry for reels.

for the shots themselves, i would say in geneal, you will need to check you black/white points as there is a little disconnect between you foreground objects (such as your greenscreen plates) and your background . for example, the shot with the helmet, the character looks way darker than anything in the background.  At around 0.21 there is a green highlight in the helmet too, but it's not obvious what in the scene would e green that causes that reflection. I would also take another look at the heat haze coming off the fire as it needs a bit of work. The catwalk shot at around 0.32 looks very dark and you are loosig a lot of detail which would be nice to keep. It's hard to see how good the key is when its this dark which i thing is what you want to demonstrate.
i hope that helps. Feel free to ask any questions if anything above is unclear
